struct  tCacheEntry

Detailed Description

Quadratic Program Solver for the C-SVM.

Author:
T. Glasmachers
Date:
2005
The training procedure iteratively solves the C-SVM dual problem:

s.t. and

The matrix K is the positive definite Gram matrix of the kernel function evaluated on the data. The matrix diag(d) K diag(d) is refered to as Q. The linear part l is an arbitrary vector. The vector d is usually nonzero in every component. The equality constraint normal e may only consist of entries +1 or -1, while the box constraint upper edge vector u has to be non-negative in every component.
The solver uses a SMO-like decomposition algorithm with MVP, HMG or LIBSVM-2.8 working set selection algorithm, all providing guaranteed convergence to the optimum. The HMG algorithm is known to be fast especially on large problems, while the LIBSVM-2.8 algorithm is fastest if the matrix Q fits into the kernel cache. Therefore, the solver's default working set selection strategy is a hybrid mixture of these two algorithms.

Definition at line 42 of file C_Solver.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

C_Solver::C_Solver ( KernelFunction *  pKernel,
const Array< double > &  data,
const Array< double > &  linearPart,

double  eps = 0.001,
const char *  strategy = "",
bool  shrinking = true,
bool  norm2 = false 
)

The constructor solves the quadratic program given as follows:.

maximize
such that
and
If the norm2 flag is set, two changes are made to the quadratic problem in order to solve the 2-norm SVM formulation: The upper box constraint is removed and its value is instead misused to regularize the kernel matrix K by

. ]

Parameters:
pKernel kernel function used for the computation of K
data data to evaluate the kernel function
linearPart linear part l of the target function
diagModificator vector; diagonal of the matrix D
equalityNormal vector e
inequalityUpper vector u of upper bounds
solutionVector input: initial feasible vector ; output: solution
solutionOffset output: affine offset b of the C-SVM solution
verbose turn status output to stdout on or off (off by default)
cacheMB megabytes of main memory to use as a kernel cache (100 by default)
eps solution accuracy, in terms of the maximum KKT violation (0.001 by default)
strategy working set selection strategy to use; values: "" (default), "MVP", "HMG", "LIBSVM28"
shrinking turn shrinking on or off (off by default)
norm2 use 2-norm slack penalties; ignore inequalityUpper

float * C_Solver::Q_row ( unsigned int  k,
int  begin,
int  end,
bool  temp = false 
) [protected]

Return the active subset of a kernel matrix row.

This method returns an array of float with at least the entries in the interval [begin, end[ filled in. If temp is set to true, the computed values are not stored in the cache.
Parameters:
k index identifying the matrix row
begin first entry to be filled in
end last entry to be filled in +1
temp are the return values temporary or should they be cached?
